alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Schuylkill; Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 07 at 6:56PM EDT until April 08 at 5:01AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Columbia, Schuylkill and Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of small streams, as well as low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM EDT, Radar showed heavy showers falling over the area, which will continue until around 10 pm, resulting in minor flooding this evening. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have already fallen in most of the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloomsburg, Pottsville, Berwick, Tamaqua, Schuylkill Haven, Shenandoah, St. Clair, Minersville, Mahanoy City, Frackville, Orwigsburg, Ashland, Valley View, Mcadoo, Pine Grove, Port Carbon, Tremont, Catawissa, Girardville and Hometown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
